alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Johnston; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 4:54AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Harnett, Johnston and Sampson. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. This includes Interstate 95 between Fayetteville and Benson. - Wade, Falcon, and Godwin are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunn, Benson, Godwin, Erwin, Eastover, Stedman, Wade, Falcon, Linden, Vander, Spivey`s Corner, Cedar Creek and Bushy Lake Natural Area.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning.
